item.description:
Come to Church with me on Thu., 11/19! Church isn't a house of worship, but rather a cool, new restaurant/rock club nestled into the Fenway neighborhood. My friends Luke and Jim are in an original rock-alt-pop band called The Buckners (whose name is inspired by Bill Buckner of Red Sox infamy). They're performing at Church as part of International Pop Overthrow, a music festival taking place concurrently in several cities around the world. For an $8 cover, you get to see seven sets. Here's the lineup:

8:00 - Corin Ashley
8:30 - Jeff Byrd & Dirty Finch
9:00 - The Buckners
9:30 - Satch Kerans
10:00 - The Doom Buggies
10:30 - Lemonpeeler
11:00 - Heath Street

At this point, I'm just planning to check out the bands. Let me know if you're interested in eating dinner at Church beforehand, though, as the menu looks really good.

Helpful tip: bring earplugs to protect your drums. ;)

Those going to Third Thursday at the Gardner Museum are welcome to join the fun. It's just a short walk across the Fens to Church. If you plan to attend, be sure to arrive by 9 so you can see The Buckners!

Church Website

http://www.churchofbo...

The Buckners Links

http://www.facebook.c...
http://www.myspace.co...

group.name: Brunch & More (20/30-Somethings for brunch & more, etc...)

item.name: International Pop Overthrow feat. The Buckners @ Church
